docs.lead_paragraph: A small New Jersey town is world-famous among Orthodox Jews as a place to come ask for handouts.
docs.abstract: Lakewood, NJ, has become world-famous among Orthodox Jews as place to come to beg for money; spiritual ecology of the town, population of which has doubled between 1990 and 2010 due to growth of ultra-Orthodox community, revolves around the Torah, which obliges that all Jews give to charity.
docs.snippet: A small New Jersey town is world-famous among Orthodox Jews as a place to come ask for handouts.

docs.lead_paragraph: Rome's center-left mayor on Saturday recognized the validity of 16 gay marriages performed outside Italy, the first such ceremony in the capital, sparking an angry reaction from the interior minister and the country's Roman Catholic Church.

headline.main: Rome Mayor Recognizes Gay Marriages, Riles Minister, Bishops
headline.print_headline: Rome Mayor Recognizes Gay Marriages, Riles Minister, Bishops

docs.snippet: Rome's center-left mayor on Saturday recognized the validity of 16 gay marriages performed outside Italy, the first such ceremony in the capital, sparking an angry reaction from the interior minister and the country's Roman Catholic Church.

docs.lead_paragraph: The largest U.S. gay-rights organization Saturday endorsed efforts to promote the use of a once-a-day pill to prevent HIV infection and called on insurers to provide more generous coverage of the drug.

headline.main: Gay-Rights Group Backs Use of HIV-Prevention Pill
headline.print_headline: Gay-Rights Group Backs Use of HIV-Prevention Pill

docs.snippet: The largest U.S. gay-rights organization Saturday endorsed efforts to promote the use of a once-a-day pill to prevent HIV infection and called on insurers to provide more generous coverage of the drug.

docs.lead_paragraph: It would be very hard to contain Ebola in a system that can't handle routine medical problems.
docs.snippet: It would be very hard to contain Ebola in a system that can't handle routine medical problems.

docs.lead_paragraph: Some people enrolled in private coverage through the Affordable Care Act are hesitating to use their insurance because of the high out-of-pocket costs.

headline.main: Unable to Meet the Deductible or the Doctor
headline.print_headline: Unable to Meet the Deductible or the Doctor

docs.abstract: Many Americans enrolled in private coverage through Affordable Care Act are hesitating to use their new insurance because of high out-of-pocket costs; insurers are required to cover certain preventive services at no cost to consumer if provider is is in their network, but for other services and items, like prescription drugs, marketplace customers often have to meet their deductible before insurance starts to help.
docs.snippet: Some people enrolled in private coverage through the Affordable Care Act are hesitating to use their insurance because of the high out-of-pocket costs.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

byline.original: By ABBY GOODNOUGH and ROBERT PEAR

docs.lead_paragraph: The C.D.C. was supposed to be the federal agency that we could trust without fail.
docs.abstract: Joe Nocera Op-Ed column holds that Centers for Disease Control and Prevention's handling of Ebola epidemic had tarnished reputation of agency once thought highly competent; contends CDC's approach to serious disease was too hubristic, and that such mistakes place agency among others that have earned public distrust.
docs.snippet: The C.D.C. was supposed to be the federal agency that we could trust without fail.

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph: Jillion Potter thinks about it all the time. The Rio Olympics. The dream of climbing the podium with the rest of the U.S. rugby team to have a medal draped around her neck.

headline.main: Column: Finally, an Inspiring Story From Sports
headline.print_headline: Column: Finally, an Inspiring Story From Sports

docs.lead_paragraph: The bankrupt Trump Taj Mahal casino received court approval on Friday to break its labor agreement, a key condition for a rescue deal with billionaire Carl Icahn, and the union promptly announced a plan to picket the Atlantic City, New Jersey hotel.

headline.main: Trump Atlantic City Casino Gets Court OK to Break Labor Deal
headline.print_headline: Trump Atlantic City Casino Gets Court OK to Break Labor Deal

docs.snippet: The bankrupt Trump Taj Mahal casino received court approval on Friday to break its labor agreement, a key condition for a rescue deal with billionaire Carl Icahn, and the union promptly announced a plan to picket the Atlantic City, New Jersey hotel.
